intro: Allioniella oxybaphoides, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Allioniella oxybaphoides is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
